metadata.title: CVE-2020-12691 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in OpenStack Keystone before 15.0.1, and 16.0.0. Any authenticated user can create an EC2 credential for themselves for a project that they have a specified role on, and then perform an update to the credential user and project, allowing them to masquerade as another user. This potentially allows a malicious user to act as the admin on a project another user has the admin role on, which can effectively grant that user global admin privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-12691` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

keystone - 2:18.0.0~b2~git2020073017.b187dfd05-0ubuntu1
keystone-common - 2:18.0.0~b2~git2020073017.b187dfd05-0ubuntu1
python3-keystone - 2:18.0.0~b2~git2020073017.b187dfd05-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: keystone package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:18.0.0~b2~git2020073017.b187dfd05-0ubuntu1').
